duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure the most efficient work steps are being taken to achieve safety, quality, productivity, on-time delivery, and cost-effective production within the Machining department.
Monitor Area Output and serve as a primary problem solver to resolve issues and restore process control.
Lead R&D and Pilot jobs, ensuring full process documentation and production run-times are recorded.
Work with Manufacturing Engineering to resolve any manufacturing issues and drive continuous improvement.
Facilitate the daily work assignments for operators to ensure production requirements meet performance targets.
Coordinate training of personnel on technical aspects of the job and demonstrate leadership role in sharing knowledge with shop personnel.
Manage small to medium scale projects related to the production environment.

education_certification.credential: Some college course work completed, and 3-4 years of experience setting up and operating CNC type machines is preferred. Equivalency to the qualification standard will also be considered.
